Job Title: Senior Executive Support Analyst

Location: Arlington, VA

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Consulting, Human Resources

Description:
Location: Arlington, VA or Washington, DC
About UsAE Strategies is a Mclean, VA based consulting firm, founded in 2003, providing people and project management solutions to federal customers. We are a proven small business with an established reputation and a track record of sustained success supporting mission critical programs across the federal government. Our employees work on challenging and impactful federal initiatives in a positive and collaborative work environment with competitive compensation and excellent benefits, including paid healthcare and 401k matching. Find out more at www.aestrategies.com.
OverviewThe Senior Executive Support Analyst will join an established AE Strategies team to support the Department of Defense Office for Diversity, Equity, and Inclusion located at the Pentagon in Arlington, VA and Navy Yard in Washington, DC. This support will help our client design and develop a program which aims to foster an equitable and inclusive environment in which leaders’ value and encourage personnel to drive innovation and mission success, ultimately achieving strategic advantages through leveraging the diversity of all personnel. Specific responsibilities will include the following:
Roles and ResponsibilitiesPerform a wide range of administrative tasks and provide administrative support to the Senior Executive Director: i) manage the executive's calendar, acting as a gatekeeper to avoid scheduling conflicts; ii) schedule meetings and video teleconferences; iii) draft, proofread, and prepare documents for signature; iv) prepare presentations and talking points in of advance meetings and/or speaking engagements; v) maintain internal and external contact lists; vi) coordinate travel, conferences and develop itineraries; vii) monitor the executive's e-mail for incoming requests for information and/or comment.Track and provide coordination actions and reporting support for Congressional and other stakeholder inquiries to include consolidation of reports and staffing of packages.Provide office administrative support such as reviewing and editing correspondence; providing administrative assistance in the packaging, scheduling, tracking, and responding to inquiries; and coordinating inputs from staff and other partner affiliations.Maintain staff meeting agendas, draft meeting minutes, due-outs, and after-action reports, and develop and maintain other office tracking tools to coordinate effective synchronization of efforts across portfolios and programs.
Required Qualifications:US Citizenship required.Eligibility for Secret Clearance required.Ability to work onsite five (5) days a week in Arlington, VA or four (4) days a week in Washington, DC required.Bachelor's degree required; Master’s degree preferred.Six (6) years' experience in support of federal government senior executives required; military experience required; DoD civilian experience a plus though not required.Highly proficient in MS Outlook for email and calendaring on DoD network required.Highly proficient in the MS Office Suite including Word, Excel, PowerPoint, SharePoint, and Teams.
AE Strategies is an equal opportunity employer.

Experience Level (if available): Mid-Senior level
